meanings.definition: An enzyme that catalyzes the hydrolysis of glucosides.
meanings.sent1: The glucosidase in our bodies helps break down sugars for energy.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study how glucosidase works to understand digestion better.
meanings.sent3: The glucosidase at the bakery seemed to magically turn sugar into fuel for the oven.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like a powerful glucosidase, breaking down obstacles in her path.
meanings.sent5: The glucosidase enzyme acts like a tiny sugar-eating machine in our cells.

meanings.definition: A protein that breaks down glucosides into glucose and other components.
meanings.sent1: The glucosidase in the stomach helps convert complex sugars into simpler forms.
meanings.sent2: The body relies on glucosidase to process carbohydrates effectively.
meanings.sent3: The glucosidase at the picnic seemed to turn all the sweets into healthy snacks.
meanings.sent4: His words were like a glucosidase, breaking down the complex issue into understandable parts.
meanings.sent5: The glucosidase protein acts like a sugar dismantler, making energy more accessible.
